channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Jikipedia turns Epstein’s emails into an encyclopedia of his powerful friends
item.description: The folks behind Jmail are at it again with a clone of Wikipedia that turns the treasure trove of data in Epstein's emails into detailed dossiers on his associates. Entries include known visits to Epstein's properties, possible knowledge of Epstein's crimes, and laws that they might have broken. The reports are dense, listing how many […]

item.title: Disney Sends ByteDance an AI Trophy in the Form of a Cease and Desist Letter Over Seedance 2.0
item.description: ByteDance's video generator wins the prize for being the splashiest new AI model of the past few weeks.

item.title: Homeland Security reportedly sent hundreds of subpoenas seeking to unmask anti-ICE accounts
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security has been increasing pressure on tech companies to identify the owners of accounts that criticize ICE.

item.title: Who remembers IRC? Clearly some hackers, as a new Linux botnet uses some incredibly old-school methods to cut costs
item.description: SSHStalker botnet uses old IRC communication, automated SSH brute-forcing, cron persistence, and cryptomining to efficiently exploit Linux servers.

item.title: Is safety is ‘dead’ at xAI?
item.description: Elon Musk is “actively” working to make xAI’s Grok chatbot “more unhinged, according to a former employee.
